intro: Zilla chamaerapistrum, commonly known as the mountain zilla, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided lobes, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels. Zilla chamaerapistrum is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
